abstract: If the valuation of Renren, China’s social networking giant, were applied to Facebook, the American company’s value would be $200 billion.
snippet: If the valuation of Renren, China’s social networking giant, were applied to Facebook, the American company’s value would be $200 billion.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs got a steal of a deal on its Facebook stake. That’s if Renren is anything to go by. Shares in Renren, China’s answer to the social networking giant, surged more than 25 percent on their first day of trading on Wednesday. That meant it was valued at nearly 100 times last year’s revenue. On that basis, Facebook is worth about $200 billion. Goldman bought in at just a quarter of that. With some bubbly assumptions, the higher figure can almost be supported.

byline.original: By Jeffrey Goldfarb, Hugo Dixon and Neil Unmack
